arts.ttl: Chris Davies makes feelings on Lyndon Dykes clear after Birmingham City star takes centre stage
arts.sum: Scotland international Dykes has been on the peripheries for much of this season, forced to watch Jay Stansfield and Alfie May plunder the goals in the league, and make do with the odd start here and there. Dykes now has three goals in three cup outings for Blues.

arts.ttl: Birmingham quick off the mark to beat Lincoln and reach FA Cup fourth round
Birmingham City set to be without five players against Lincoln City
arts.sum: Lee Buchanan has been ruled out for the remainder of the season with a serious knee injury, while Krystian Bielik, Jay Stansfield, Emil Hansson and Keshi Anderson all succumbed to minor issues over Christmas and New Year. Bielik was battered and bruised after the New Year's Day draw with Stockport to such an extent that he wasn't available for the game at Wigan last weekend.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies makes promise to Alfons Sampsted over Birmingham City loan
arts.sum: Davies said: “He’s been in and out at the start, then he made a good impact in a few games, one in particular against Huddersfield when he got the second assist for the goal, but his injury has knocked him really and he was out for quite a while. Davies insists Sampsted’s versatility will give him chances in the second half of the season.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies gives Phil Neumann response and hints at Birmingham City starter vs Lincoln
arts.sum: Peacock-Farrell and Allsop have started one FA Cup game and two Vertu Trophy games apiece this season. Davies explained: “The idea for Bailey is that he’s played in recent cup matches so looking towards the weekend I would envisage Bailey getting an opportunity to play in that, but I haven’t gone as far as the Swindon game yet.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City weighing up immediate future of player admired by Brentford
arts.sum: Birmingham City boss Chris Davies has said they are ‘speaking’ to Romelle Donovan about his next steps this… The post Birmingham City weighing up immediate future of player admired by Brentford appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies snubbed again despite Birmingham City’s near-perfect month
arts.sum: He was pipped to it in August by Wrexham manager Phil Parkinson and Blackpool boss Steve Bruce beat him to it in September in a month where Blues won all of their league games. Chris Davies has again missed out on the Manager of the Month award – despite Birmingham City’s near-perfect month in League One.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies gives Romelle Donovan update with Birmingham City wary of transfer rule
arts.sum: Should Blues opt to play Donovan in a competitive game they then wouldn’t be able to loan him out to another club. Birmingham City are in dialogue with Romelle Donovan in a bid to formulate a new plan for the talented teenager after his failed loan spell at Burton Albion.

arts.ttl: Preview: Birmingham City vs. Lincoln City - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's FA Cup clash between Birmingham City and Lincoln City, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies all but rules Birmingham City quartet out of Lincoln City match
arts.sum: Chris Davies isn’t optimistic that key duo Krystian Bielik and Jay Stansfield will be available for this weekend’s FA Cup tie with Lincoln City. Davies added: “Keshi is not a long one but he’s very doubtful for this weekend.
